review_title: Big difference between perception and reality.

cons:

DBS wins a lot of awards, which leads to a mismatch between culture and practice.

pros: Excellent brand in banking with  a great legacy . Invests heavily in technology .  A deep pocketed bank.

The double whammy is that the Human Resource of the  bank are an invisible army who do nothing, know nothing and are just yes men to the business. They lack independent view and don’t intervene at all where ideally they should . There is no employee centricity for the HR at all .

review_title: Mistake one would never want to do
pros:
- DBS offers a high package for attracting people initially
- Good market value in the market but no hikes for the employee.
- I am happy to be working under a green field project where I got to learn otherwise it's mostly maintenance of the system.
cons:
People start to leave DBS within the year after they join. Company fails to retain them.
Many reasons for doing so:
- No future planning and goals for the work carried on.
- No sufficient hikes and bonuses
- Non-stop working and continuous pressure from heads
- Managers are inefficient and are self-obsessed
- No one cares about the low-level employees. Everyone is only interested in their own hikes and bonuses.
- Continuous nagging on the work assigned towards completion.
- Overloaded work with no work-life balance.

pros: Employee Friendly and proactive bank
cons: Department politics gets a bit toxic

pros: No pros at all, things only look good here from far away, you'll notice reality is different once you join
cons:
1. I have been working at DBS for the past couple of years, I have nothing but regrets as I was abused both physically and mentally by manager.
2. I got treated like a slave rather than an employee, I feel so helpless in these tough covid times where switching jobs is difficult.
3. My manager scolded me in front of everyone for one hour and humiliated me for something that wasn't even my fault, how am I supposed to deliver when the business analyst has no idea about requirements themselves? This used to happen before work from home as well, my manager grabbed my collar and pushed me while scolding me
4. Please don't join this company, I have no other reason to write this review than to create awareness, don't be fooled by the salary they offer, are you willing to sacrifice your reputation and respect? Are you willing to become a slave you gets abused every two weeks?

Thin twice before you join, I would recommend to join a lesser paying job with good work life balance and where employees are not treated like slaves.

I sacrificed my honor and respect for money, don't follow what I did, even if one person benefits from my warning, I will consider it worth my effort

review_title: Toxic place.. Zero work life balance
pros: Benefits.. but they are shadowed by cons.
cons:
1.There is no planning for anything.. neither projects nor people’s career.
2.Requirements are not clear to product managers even till it’s ready for prod deployment.. I have experienced a project release which got reverted on user testing day in prod.
3. Most laughable thing : Mangers think and say that agile means we will it have requirements on day 1 , we need to ask questions, document the info. 
So, When should basic requirement analysis be done? After pushing developers to start Dev? Whose responsibility is this? Well in most of DBS Ibgt teams it’s developer’s responsibility to get requirements etc etc.
4. People’s career is joke to them, it goes like there is a requirement and oh here is a person who looks free just give it to him. Does it match his career goals ? Does he have knowledge on it? Does he need to learn and deliver? Nothing is thought of and deadlines are set without considering anything just a random date when user needs.. that’s it.
5. Employees are expected to work any number of hours and even after that they are not given enough support when needed. Thankless culture,
6. No pay balance at all .
7. Just a brain draining and stupid place to work at.
8. To top it all, HR ppl are of no use than sending out mails about policy changes .. this benefit that benefit.. wellness etc etc and in real nothing changes.

pros: You get salary in time is the only benefit one has
cons:
- Absolutely toxic environment with hierarchical biases
- Rubbish marketing leadership with no team building skills
Or respect for any team members.
- Unprofessional behaviour and biases overseen
- No attention paid towards team motivation
- Ulterior motive based leadership with personal agendas favoured
- No sense of achievement or skill building in any work produced
- Expected to work like a donkey and behave like a pig - not encouraged to speak out. Your suggestions and inputs can go in dustbins your experience have no value in front of hierarchal pressures. Do as you are told culture - questioning / deliberating not allowed neither encouraged. 
- Back door hierarchical pressure put on employees who try to voice out concerns.
-  Getting your leaves approved is privilege here which you can seek not more than a week even if you give 4 months prior notice
-  No empowerment to take decisions- you need to ask everything and when a critical decision is to be made no one answers calls / nor emails / nor official chats under the pretext of being busy. I wonder if these stale holders are so busy and working so hard then why the bank is in loss.
- No decisions being taken; which gives a sense of lack of leadership and decision making skills.
- No sense of direction or objective for the brand - even the brand guidelines of the brand are evolving depending on which side of the bed the marketing communication lead gets up and her mood.
- Absolutely fake face value put up internally this organisation has critical cracks within the culture and functionally.
- That the above nonsense is being overseen is the biggest proof that the leadership is highly misplaced / misjudged.
- Zero work life balance - expected to work late everyday and should be open to calls on weekends as well while your bosses chill. Again what Rubbish leadership.

How can an organisation function without direction without basic functional truth and how can an organisation accommodate such a Rubbish leadership in the marketing team.

Please do not take up jobs here - people have fallen mentally ill. Seek advice from the market and reach out to colleagues and take their opinion about this organisation before joining.

8) I had many bad experiences please pardon me for not posting

review_title: Join Here If You Wanna Ruin Your Life!
pros:
Technology stack
Learning opportunities
Office infrastructure
Transport facility
cons:
Horrible work pressure

Work life balance is a joke here

Not paid proportionately, freshers (not IIT / NIT / IIM grads) might earn higher than a 6 years experienced, so negotiate higher initially. Due to high basic, tax deductions are very high, thanks to our Govt. as well

Notice period and buyout option are probably the worst

'C2E' LOB is probably the worst

Good technology stack but you might get a chance to watch those from distance only and work in normal business logic development with vanilla coding

Singapore management team is not employee focused

Always tend to get a workload of 5 people get done by 2 people only, that also reduce to 1 if possible

Work from home was usually possible always but management never encouraged or allowed any, just due to covid they were forced to allow it, that too late while others already started. WFH is not a boon but curse here, your 9hrs of office duration gets easily stretched to 12 - 13 hrs usually.

review_title: DAH2 is a great organization to start career with
pros:
Pay is better than most companies.
Manager and upper management supported immensely when I was going through personal issues (loss of loved ones in family).
Good WFH options during the pandemic, as I am able to do 100% of my work from home, never had to go to office since the last one year.
Excellent increment, company rewards loyal employees.
Work load mostly manageable.
Some use cases are very fun to work in analytics.
Good hackathon and data focus, and frequent contests with rewards.
Free transport and coffee if you come to office, reimbursable internet bills if you are working from home.
Good coding culture. Some colleagues are brilliant in coding, you can learn a lot from them.
Insurance policy is great, got cashless claim on a surgery and it covered everything except a few antibiotics.
Separate flexible benefits that can be used for dental, gym membership, etc. Was able to get WFH office setup via the extra amount provided for pandemic related expenditure.
CTC documents are very transparent, no misleading options to inflate CTC.
Good gifts given by the company to employees.
Good training and focus on learning and development.
Mandatory block leave for all employees, very useful to relax.
cons:
It is a bank, so there are some restrictions on the work laptop and VPN, so you don't have a lot of freedom there.
Deployment and release process is a bit problematic but they are working on streamlining it, it's much better than it was last year.
Sometimes have to work late or on weekends. However, they are trying to reduce this and provide compensatory leave if you work on a holiday.

review_title: MY VOICE (annual survey) IS NOT ANONYMOUS
pros: Good pay and benefits but other that nothing else
cons:
DAH2 management and HR stresses a lot about my voice and ask you to submit honest feedback so that they can use that to improve, but in actuality your managers threaten you to provide good ratings to them. If anyone provides a negative feedback, they find out who that person is and take it on themselves to ruin their careers. My manager explicitly called out my name in a meeting and openly showed my feedback to my team members.
They can narrow down such feedback by slicing and dicing etc and use it to target individuals giving poor scores.
Then they waited for the year end review process to halt my progress and gave me bad ratings, without any proper communication, reasons and threaten to put me in performance improvement when i tried to be reasonable.
Never had such atrocious experience in my 10 plus years of experience
HR doesn’t seem to have much power either

review_title: Good benifits but Bad work culture
pros:
Cab facility(regular times, extra hours at scheduled times)
Can claim for food bills and cab bills if you are working extra time. Mostly no limit on the bills.
Overall good salaries and bonus(based on the project budget)
Training sessions and technical competitions.
Good looking workplace designs.
Helping HR teams and office staffs.
High end laptops to work.
Special focus on ladies security.
Lots of celebrations, food festivals, outing.
Gym bills reimbursement. 
Indoor games, TT, billiards,  carom board etc.
cons:
No time limits. Extend almost everyday atleast 4more hours.
They dont feel shy to please for work on every saturday and sunday.
Compoffs and leaves are just name sake.
Middle Management is timepass. They just make work done by subordinates and submit as they work.
People Managers are more then technical Managers.
Spends plenty of money for celebrations, when comes to salary hike, they say budget.
Only one resting room for over 1000 employees.
If two persons sick at same time. Other person to stay at his workplace or to leave home. 
No resting and freshup facility for the staff who had to work more then 24hrs countinously(mostly on saturdays and Sunday long running CRs)
Impractical decisions by Management side.
No process and no formalities untill work goes.
20% of employees works on more than one project. Officially one, unofficially many.
Somewhere people who simply impress managers can stay longer and get promotions rather than who takes responsibilities and complete work in time.
